field_definitions.description: As salaam u alaikum  wa Rahmatullahi wa Barakatu Imams/Muallimahs! üëã  The Hardship Relief Fund was created as a safety net to assist Imams with financial support to help them with any unexpected expenses that may arise such as medical bills, medication, accidents, car and home repairs and in recent events, natural disasters. The beneficiaries of the fund are the Imam/Muallimah, their family and their community. The Hardship Relief Fund will cover the following for the Imam/Muallimah/Their family/community: 1. Medical Bills (Example doctors visits) 2. Medication 3. Relief Assistance (Sudden injury, natural disaster, unforeseen accidents) 4. Car and Home Repairs (Broken roof, new tyres, burst geyser) 5. Natural Disasters  6. Imams discretion - Any request submitted that an Imam may feel will ease the burden of another Muslim. He may submit a request to the Hardship Relief Fund.   üìå Process:  1. The Imam/Muallimah will fill in the Hardship Relief Application Form to apply for the funds.  2. Once received, we will review the application.   3. The IDP will touch base with the Imam/Muallimah if any further information is required.   4. Once approved, the money will paid out to the Imam to fulfil the request.   üìå Please note:  1. All funds are to be used to fulfil the request ONLY and not for any other reason. (Example: Imams petrol costs etc)  2. The recipients of the Hardship Relief fund can ONLY be Muslims.   3. Requests are subject to an assessment pending approval.   The Messenger of Allah (Ô∑∫) said: ‚ÄúWhoever removes a worldly hardship from a believer, Allah will remove one of the hardships of the Day of Resurrection from him. Whoever grants respite to (a debtor) who is in difficulty, Allah will grant him relief in this world and in the Hereafter. Whoever conceals (the fault of) a Muslim in this world, Allah will conceal him (his faults) in this world and in the Hereafter. Allah will help a person so long as he is helping his brother." -  Muslim Should you have any further questions and queries you may contact Sayed on +27 76 190 7174   Jazaak'Allah Khairan

field_definitions.field_name: As salaam u alaikum Imams and Muallimahs! üëã  We are excited to open applications for Higher Education opportunities for the upcoming academic year. This initiative supports Imams and Muallimahs in pursuing accredited qualifications to enhance their impact and leadership in the community.  üéì Eligibility and Process:    Imams and Muallimahs may choose 1 Higher Education course or qualification to pursue in 2026. This can be a part-time or full-time program, completed online or in-person.    Applicants are required to find an accredited institution offering their chosen qualification.    Please obtain a brochure/prospectus and a formal quotation (with duration, fees, and course content) from the institution.    Attach your quotation, course brochure/prospectus, and a one-page motivation letter to the form before submitting.    Deadline for applications: 22 January 2026    üìå Important Notes:    Preference will be given to Active Imams with a strong CPD and community engagement record.    The qualification should align with Islamic leadership, education, social service, or personal/professional development.    A Motivation Letter (minimum one full page) is required. This letter must explain:    Why you want to pursue this qualification    How it aligns with your current or future community work    The positive impact it will have on your role and responsibilities      Incomplete applications or those without proper documentation will not be considered.    Selected candidates may be required to sign a commitment agreement and submit progress reports each semester.    üìò Examples of Eligible Qualifications:    BA in Islamic Studies    Diploma in Counselling or Psychology    Degree in Education or Teaching    Degree/Diploma in Public Administration, Social Work, or Development Studies    Bachelor of Business Administration    Any relevant NQF-level accredited course aligned with your goals  * If you‚Äôre unsure about a course, feel free to reach out to the Life Skills & Higher Education Coordinator for some advice.  For any questions or queries please contact Helpdesk ‚Ä™‚Ä™‚Ä™+27 65 903 3117‚Ä¨‚Ä¨‚Ä¨‚Ä¨‚Ä¨‚Ä¨‚Ä¨    Jazakallah Khairan, IDP Programs Team

The Imam Development Program is encouraging its Imams and their communities to take part in planting trees in different countries within the IDP catchment area. Planting trees is regarded as Sadaqatul-Jaariya (ongoing charity). The one who plants trees will be rewarded for it as long as any living being benefits from it. The Prophet Muhammed Ô∑∫ said: ‚ÄúThere is none amongst the Muslims who plants a tree or sows seeds, and then a bird, or a person or an animal eats from it, but is regarded as a charitable gift for him.‚Äù (Bukhari) üìå Process: 1. The Imam/Muallimah will fill in and submit the Tree Planting Form to request the amount of tree's they are able to plant.  2. Once approved, the requestor will receive R50 per tree (Other regions) and R25 (Tanzania). If you are able to purchase more than one tree with the monies allocated per tree, you may go ahead and do so.  3. The Imam/Muallimah will source the trees locally.  4. The Imam/Muallimah and their students/community will plant the trees together.  5. Each students will be allocated a tree and is entrusted to look after their tree ensuring their tree grows best. 6. Once all trees have been planted. Send your update to the IDP Trees group.  üìå Please Note:  1. All funds are to be used for trees ONLY.   2. Trees should be at a early mature stage (50cm height (centimetres) or more  3. Any tree can be planted but fruit trees are preferable.  4.  If you are able to purchase more than one tree for R50, you may go ahead and do so.   Should you have any further questions and queries you may contact Sayed on +27 76 190 7174   Jazaak'Allah Khairan  Sayed Aalim
